intro: Cyphostemma masukuense, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by elongated, cylindrical fruits. Cyphostemma masukuense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is also noted for its use in traditional medicine.
